item.title: Its not that good but :( auto-talker Updated: 2auto
item.dc:creator: @junkj junkj
item.description:
@junkj wrote:

text is hard,you need a shift keys function ron had it somewhere.
ill find it…[br][size=1]Posted on: January 17, 2007, 03:55:26 PM[/size][hr]edit: found it!

Procedure Shift(b : byte);
Begin
  Wait(20+Random(30));
  KeyDown(16)
  Wait(20+Random(30));
  KeyDown(b);
  Wait(20+Random(30));
  KeyUp(b)
  Wait(20+Random(30));
  KeyUp(16);
  Wait(20+Random(30));
End;

Read full topic

item.title: Its not that good but :( auto-talker Updated: 2auto
item.dc:creator: @joey0101 joey0101
item.description:
@joey0101 wrote:

Congrats on your first script, just a small pointer,

instead of
SendKeysVB(’{ENTER}’ false);

You could use
Sendkeys(whattosay+chr(13));

chr(13) is the bytecode for Enter i think.

other than that its great for a first script, better than mine i have to say.

Read full topic

item.title: Its not that good but :( auto-talker Updated: 2auto
item.dc:creator: @Cabby Cabby
item.description:
@Cabby wrote:

I dont really know how to code that well but this is it.

[glow=red,2,300]Auto-Talker V1.0![/glow]

[code]// Visit moparisthebest.com for more of my scripts.

program Autotalker;
Const
Whattosay = ‘TEXTHERE’;//Type F1 to say
begin
writeln(‘You Are Currently Using Cabbys Auto-Talker!’)
repeat
if(IsFKeyDown(1))then
begin
sendkeys(Whattosay);
SendKeysVb(’{ENTER}’,false);
end;
wait(300);//Keeps it from saying it more than once on only one click
//if you remove it, it will keep saying it. I suggest not to.
until(false)
end.
//|-------------------------------------|
//| Thanks for using Cabbys Auto-talker!|
//|-------------------------------------|[/code]

[glow=red,2,300]Auto-Talker v1.1![/glow]

[code]//Find more of my scripts at Moparisthebest.com

program AutoTalker;

Const
TextColor=‘cyan:’; //What color to write in
// green, cyan, purple, etc.
// can not use “Blue, or Yellow”!
WhatToSay=‘hello’; //What to say
begin
repeat
if(isFKeyDown(1)) then
begin
sendkeys(TextColor);
sendkeys(WhatToSay);
SendKeysVb(’{ENTER}’, false);
end;
wait(300); // Keeps it from saying it to often
until(false)
end.
//|-------------|
//| THANKS |
//|-------------|[/code]

Read full topic
